There is something to walk around and games for children. Tap with drinking water. Despite the festival, we were only a few Vans and CCs on this huge parking lot, so all very well-off and spaced out. title: (28034) Madrid - 10 Calle Condestables
description:
A free and fairly quiet car park both during the day and at night.

A 10 minute walk from a metro stop. And by bike 10 minutes from the Castellana.

Highly recommended for old or unlabeled campers, since they cannot enter the m30 and interior of Madrid, due to the environment.

There are no parking lots so close and free around the city.

The only drawback is that it has quite a few holes in the ground, be careful with the bass, although going slow is no problem.

description: Park with parking area to spend the night. With public toilets, tables, children's playground

description: Parking area green / blue free from 8pm and weekends. It is very close to the Chamartin metro and train station and the Plaza de Castilla bus and metro station. There is a market nearby, as well as bakeries, bars and other services. There are good views of the four towers but it is a bit noisy area being close to the Castellana.

title: (28033) Madrid - 4 Calle de Julia Balenchana
description: It is a quiet cul-de-sac so you can spend the night without hearing a lot of noise. There are no houses on the street, just some kind of convent and the street is practically dead. down the street and to the right there is a fountain. down the street and across there is a park. more or less nearby there are some shops

title: (28027) Madrid - 55C Calle Miami
description: Very quiet and safe road to leave the motorhome and visit Madrid. It parks very well outside office hours. It is an area of ​​upscale family homes. Connected to a beautiful park "Quinta de los Molinos". Very famous for its almond trees in bloom at the beginning of spring. Flat and wide street for parking. Metro very close.

title: (28022) Madrid - 26K Calle de Estocolmo
description: Parking in a quiet street with some shade, next to trees and well leveled. If you arrive the day before, ideal place to attend an event in Wanda, source and playground. Metro station at 100 m, next to the Green Ring to travel Madrid by bike

title: (28034) Madrid - 11F Avenida del Monasterio de El Escorial

title: (28723) Pedrezuela - 1 Diseminado Arroyo Prados
description: Good place to spend the day and night. A few meters ahead there is a no-trespassing sign. We enter through C. Àvila. The entire reservoir is surrounded by a fence, since bathing is prohibited. It is a fishing ground and many fishermen jump that fence to spend the day with the rod on the shore. In the morning many cyclists and people walking. There are containers, please make use of them, we saw a lot of garbage on the walk we did .. a shame. From the E-5, send a chunk along a road with many potholes, take the detour and pass by the restaurant "Los nueva hornos de Ángel".

title: (28046) Madrid - 2A Calle Tulipan
description: Free gravel parking used by locals. It's a little hard to find the right entry. It seems unregulated but everybody uses it and you won't get a ticket. The entry roads are VERY bumpy with lots of potholes, it gets better inside the parking and it's worth it, you won't find a free parking as well situated in Madrid. It's very close to one of the main train stations (CHAMARTIN) and bus stations (PLAZA DE CASTILLA) and there are bars and supermarkets all around. It's also unusually silent for it's location appart from the rush hours where people parks in our out to go to work/home. I asked around and everybody said that it was a very safe place to park as well.

title: (28033) Madrid - 22 Calle Pedro Salinas
description: Quiet area where you can leave the motorhome and spend the night, has no services, but there are shops, supermarkets, parks, bus stops, restaurants.  Nearby (you can walk to all of them).

title: (28794) -
description: Beautiful place to spend the night without being disturbed by almost anything because you cannot bathe but if it is for fishing, hiking and MTB ... there are no shadows (a shame) ... we have been one night and great ... .But in the afternoon the guard passed by and did not tell us anything .... if you run out of water you have outside the yacht club (left side) a fountain along the walkway that is on the hiking route (bring a lot of water and cream that in summer you roast or heat handles ... be careful when entering the road has many potholes, go slowly ...... enjoy it but respect it and take care of it .. Thank you

title: (28028) Madrid - 79 Avenida Toreros
description: Next to the Plaza de Toros de Las Ventas. Urban transport and the city nearby. Parking closed on bullfighting days.

title: (28840) Mejorada del Campo - 3 Calle Argentina
description: Ideal parking to visit the Cathedral of Justo in Mejorada Del Campo. Famous for his Aquarius ad. Spectacular to see the building. The car park is large and great for RVs and Vans. The Police are right in front, so in theory it is a quiet and safe place. You can walk to the Cathedral and there is also a bike lane. Supermarkets, Gas Station, Burger next door. There is a charger for Electric Cars. Very good communication with Carreteras de Madrid such as the M50 or R3 and it is also next to Alcalá De Henares, which is also worth a visit!

title: (28032) Madrid - 83 Calle de Villablanca
description: Secure parking is near the police station

description: Next to the soccer field, near the Antonio Machado subway to hear downtown. Quiet area, there is noise when they play football but at night it is quiet to sleep. there are always motorhomes parked.

title_short: (28817) Los Santos de la Humosa - 5Z Paseo de la Visera

description: It is a park that you can see that the works have been finished very recently and they are just putting up trees, we have spent 2 very quiet nights. some motorhomes staying overnight but the stalls are small so the motorhomes I have seen parked were occupying 3 stalls. It is a dirt car park with very little unevenness. good for fall - winter - spring, no big trees yet and no cover from the sun. being from land there is a lot of dust and having the windows open is a disaster

title: (28032) Madrid - Blvr. de Jose Prat
description: We discovered this place through a blog. It is free and you can stay overnight. Apparently there are always motorhomes parked here. We spent one night and everything was fine. Safe. It has a shopping center in front and the neighborhood is quiet with large parks.

description: Drinking water source.

title: (19160) Chiloeches - 507P Arrabal Sector 14 Zona Mixta
description: Picnic area with 4 tables, no parking bays, branches in the way, 3m are already scarce. Road quite loud, many trucks at high speed. Great for a walk.

title: (28048) Madrid - 1D Calle Almenas
description: Close to the center, along a busy road, but there are currently several campers, parking is officially not allowed along the (quite quiet) road with a park next to it.

title: (28180) Torrelaguna - 9 Calle Soria
description: Parking on public roads. C / Bernaldo de Quiros. It is a wide street and you can park in line without problem. The water change is next to the sports center but since it is not an area, you can look for this place to spend the night. Typical noises of people walking and a vehicle from time to time. It is right on the side of the Varguillas stream and on the other side are the houses. Public lighting and containers. Level.

title_short: (28794) Guadalix de la Sierra - 30 Carretera Vieja del Pantano

There is no lighting.
